Package modes

Interface RoverMode

All Known Implementing Classes:
DiagnosticMode, ErrorMode, ExplorationMode, HarvestMode, LandingMode, SleepMode, WaitMode
public interface RoverMode
Interface to use any rover mode indifferently. During its life, the rover will be in a few different modes. However they all share the following properties, summed up inside the RoverMode interface
Author:
Antoine Stevan
See Also:
LandingMode, DiagnosticMode, ErrorMode, ExplorationMode, HarvestMode, WaitMode, SleepMode

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int DIAGNOSTIC
    Code for the diagnostic mode.
    static int ERROR
    Code for the error mode.
    static int EXPLORATION
    Code for the exploration mode.
    static int HARVEST
    Code for the harvest mode.
    static int LANDING
    Code for the landing mode.
    static int SLEEP
    Code for the sleep mode.
    static int WAIT
    Code for the wait mode.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void start()
    Start a mode for the rover.
    void stop()
    Stop a mode for the rover.

  • Field Details

    • LANDING

      static final int LANDING
      Code for the landing mode. When the rover has just landed on Mars, this is the appropriate code to be used in Blinker.blink(int, int) or Blinker.blink(int, int, int). This will trigger the right sounds and light effects.
      See Also:
      Blinker.blink(int, int), Blinker.blink(int, int, int), Constant Field Values

    • DIAGNOSTIC

      static final int DIAGNOSTIC
      Code for the diagnostic mode. When the rover is under internal inspection, this is the appropriate code to be used in Blinker.blink(int, int) or Blinker.blink(int, int, int). This will trigger the right sounds and light effects.
      See Also:
      Blinker.blink(int, int), Blinker.blink(int, int, int), Constant Field Values

    • ERROR

      static final int ERROR
      Code for the error mode. When the internal inspection of the rover reports any error, this is the appropriate code to be used in Blinker.blink(int, int) or Blinker.blink(int, int, int). This will trigger the right sounds and light effects.
      See Also:
      Blinker.blink(int, int), Blinker.blink(int, int, int), Constant Field Values

    • EXPLORATION

      static final int EXPLORATION
      Code for the exploration mode. When the rover has to explore its environment to locate samples, this is the appropriate code to be used in Blinker.blink(int, int) or Blinker.blink(int, int, int). This will trigger the right sounds and light effects.
      See Also:
      Blinker.blink(int, int), Blinker.blink(int, int, int), Constant Field Values

    • HARVEST

      static final int HARVEST
      Code for the harvest mode. When the rover has located a sample and needs to harvest it, this is the appropriate code to be used in Blinker.blink(int, int) or Blinker.blink(int, int, int). This will trigger the right sounds and light effects.
      See Also:
      Blinker.blink(int, int), Blinker.blink(int, int, int), Constant Field Values

    • WAIT

      static final int WAIT
      Code for the wait mode. When the rover has to wait until a button is pressed, this is the appropriate code to be used in Blinker.blink(int, int) or Blinker.blink(int, int, int). This will trigger the right sounds and light effects.
      See Also:
      Blinker.blink(int, int), Blinker.blink(int, int, int), Constant Field Values

    • SLEEP

      static final int SLEEP
      Code for the sleep mode. When the rover is sleeping after all its work, this is the appropriate code to be used in Blinker.blink(int, int) or Blinker.blink(int, int, int). This will trigger the right sounds and light effects.
      See Also:
      Blinker.blink(int, int), Blinker.blink(int, int, int), Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • start

      void start()
      Start a mode for the rover. Every RoverMode can start a sequence of sound and light effects.
      See Also:
      LandingMode, DiagnosticMode, ErrorMode, ExplorationMode, HarvestMode, WaitMode, SleepMode

    • stop

      void stop()
      Stop a mode for the rover. Every RoverMode can stop a sequence of sound and light effects.
      See Also:
      LandingMode, DiagnosticMode, ErrorMode, ExplorationMode, HarvestMode, WaitMode, SleepMode
